posts.name: Allswell
posts.note: Allswell is a seasonally-driven, rustic American pub located in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. They work closely with farmers and purveyors to source fresh, interesting ingredients for their guests. Allswell's approach is casual, and their menu changes frequently to keep fresh energy flowing throughout the seasons. From their website, 'ALLSWELL is a seasonally-driven, rustic American pub located in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. We work closely with farmers and purveyors to source fresh, interesting ingredients for our guests. Allswell's approach is casual, and our menu changes frequently in order to keep fresh energy flowing throughout the seasons.'

posts.name: Champs Diner
posts.note: Champs Diner serves vegan baked goods and comfort-food items in a retro diner setting. NOTE:Cash only.

posts.name: Di Fara Pizza
posts.note: Di Fara Pizza serves pizza fans that trek to this no-frills Midwood storefront and queue up to partake of its storied slices. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Du's Donuts
posts.note: Du's Donuts is a modern stop at The William Vale hotel for inventive cake donuts, and crullers, along with coffee and cold brew. Du’s Donuts & Coffee serves Chef Wylie Dufresne’s recipe for New England-style cake donuts and crullers in classic and imaginative flavors.

posts.name: Fort Defiance
posts.note: Fort Defiance serves classic cocktails paired with seasonal American fare and weekend brunch in a vintage-inspired setting. From their website, 'At Fort Defiance, we strive to source our meats, dairy, fruits, and vegetables locally and responsibly. All of our eggs and most of our seasonal fruits and vegetables come from Lancaster Farm Fresh Co-op, a nonprofit collective of organic family farms in Pennsylvania. Our milk is from Battenkill Valley Creamery in Salem, NY, the freshest and tastiest milk available. We buy our meat from Pino Prime Meats, a hundred-year-old butcher shop in SoHo, right down the street from Grandaisy Bakery, where our bread is baked.'

posts.name: Hometown Bar-B-Que
posts.note: Hometown Bar-B-Que's rustic counter-service features slow smoked meats, craft beer, and live music on weekends. The dishes to get are the Korean sticky ribs and the lamb belly with pickled red onions.

posts.name: One Girl Cookies
posts.note: One Girl Cookies is a charming bakery offering cookies and cakes plus coffee, savory snacks, wine, and beer. They serve the same delicious treats, breakfast items, and coffee beverages that they serve at their flagship store.

posts.name: Totonno’s
posts.note: Totonno’s is a beloved old-school joint furnishing thin-crust coal-oven pizza to Coney Island crowds since 1924.
posts.rcmmnd: Ugly Delicious and Somebody Feed Phil
